title.value: Generative AI in Software Engineering Must Be Human-Centered: The Copenhagen Manifesto
title.justification: The title of the paper is found at the beginning, "Generative AI in Software Engineering Must Be Human-Centered: The Copenhagen Manifesto."
title.quote: Generative AI in Software Engineering Must Be Human-Centered: The Copenhagen Manifesto

extractions.description: This paper discusses the necessity of integrating human-centered approaches in the use of Generative AI in software engineering, highlighting ethical, social, legal, and technical challenges.

type.justification: The paper is a manifesto, which typically presents theoretical frameworks or principles rather than empirical findings.
type.quote: this manifesto equally underscores the ripple effects such innovations have on end-users of software, shaping their experiences and interactions in profound ways.

name.justification: The focus is on software engineering researchers and practitioners integrating Generative AI.
name.quote: While primarily aimed at software engineering (SE) researchers and practitioners, who are at the forefront of integrating Generative AI into our digital infrastructure...

name.justification: The paper focuses on the impact and integration of Generative AI within software engineering.
name.quote: The advent of Generative Artificial Intelligence—systems that can produce human-like content such as text, music, visual art, or source code—marks not only a significant leap for Artificial Intelligence (AI)...
